channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [BATCH-1378] Late binding of parameters in map value only happens once per ApplicationContext
item.description:
See thorough description in the forum, which also have the related classes, configuration and log attached.
In essence the binding of the parameters only happens once, so that any subsequent executions will run with stale values.
item.environment:
was 6.1 (also happens outside of container / in unit-test)
spring batch 2.0.2 and also 2.0.3.CI
item.summary: Late binding of parameters in map value only happens once per ApplicationContext

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Actually a blocker as I can't find any good workarounds.
It works for me. What is your database platform?

Did the config look correct to you?
I'm using DB2 9.5 - but I can't see how that should influence it - as the JDBC stuff is fed the wrong values.
Could this be some bad proxying?

Don't know at this stage. Can you show the logs from org.springframework.batch.core (DEBUG level)? I'd like to see the JobLauncher tell me that the parameters are indeed as we think they are, and the PlaceholderTargetSource binding the job parameters.

Is the first execution of your job successful (status=COMPLETED)?

fgrep -i 'org.springframework.batch.core.launch' Generic.lol:

21/08/2009 17:23:16,920 [main] INFO org.springframework.batch.core.launch.support.SimpleJobLauncher - No TaskExecutor has been set, defaulting to synchronous executor.
